SEARCH
Package Helpers

Class ObjectJson

java.lang.Object
Helpers.ObjectJson
public class ObjectJson extends Object
The ObjectJson class provides methods for serializing and deserializing objects to and from JSON format. It uses the Gson library to perform the serialization and deserialization.

  • Constructor Details

    • ObjectJson

      public ObjectJson()

  • Method Details

    • objectToJson

      public static void objectToJson(Object object)
      A static method that serializes an object to a JSON file using the JsonIdentifiable interface to get the file name from the object. The file is created in a subdirectory 'JSON Files' within the package directory of the object's class.
      Parameters:
      object - The object to be serialized to JSON.

    • getFileInPackageDir

      public static File getFileInPackageDir(Object object)

    • objectFromJson

      public static <T> T objectFromJson(String fileName, Class<T> contextClass)
      Deserializes a JSON file to an object. Attempts to find the passed json file name in the package directory of the passed class.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the object to be deserialized. (This is automatically inferred from the contextClass parameter)
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the JSON file to be deserialized, this is defined by the JsonIdentifiable interface implemented by the object.
      contextClass - The class of the object to be deserialized.
      Returns:
      The deserialized object.

    • getClassDir

      public static String getClassDir(Class<?> passedClass) throws ClassCastException
      Retrieves an array of File objects representing all the files in the directory associated with a given class.
      Parameters:
      passedClass - The class whose associated directory's files are to be listed.
      Returns:
      An array of File objects, or null if the directory does not exist, is not a directory, or is empty.
      Throws:
      ClassCastException

    • listFiles

      public static File[] listFiles(Class<?> passedClass)
      Retrieves an array of File objects representing all the files in the directory associated with a given class.
      Parameters:
      passedClass - The class whose associated directory's files are to be listed.
      Returns:
      An array of File objects, or null if the directory does not exist, is not a directory, or is empty.

    • searchObject

      public static Object searchObject(String jsonId, Class<?> contextClass)
      Searches for an object with a given JSON ID in the directory associated with a given class.
      Parameters:
      jsonId - The JSON ID of the object to search for.
      contextClass - The class of the object to search for.
      Returns:
      The object if found, or null if not found.

    • deleteObject

      public static void deleteObject(String jsonId, Class<?> contextClass)
      Deletes an object with a given JSON ID from the directory associated with a given class.
      Parameters:
      jsonId - The JSON ID of the object to delete.
      contextClass - The class of the object to delete.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Example usage of objectToJson and objectFromJson This example creates a Product object, writes it to a JSON file, then recalls the object from the JSON file. The jsonId is defined by the JsonIdentifiable interface implemented by the object. --
      Parameters:
      args - Unused
